TemplateConfiguration._Description: Creates a new DNN extension packaging project using MSBuild. Add this to the solution containing one or more DNN extensions (modules).

Files.File:
# Initial setup of packaging project
This template uses MSBuild to create install packages, but due to template engine limitations it will require some changes to be made manually in a project file.
1. Open `${ProjectName}.csproj` in text editor or add it to project files.
2. Just after last `<Import Project="..." />` directive insert this code:
``` <!-- Begin snippet --> <Import Project="..\packages\MSBuildTasks.1.4.0.128\tools\MSBuild.Community.Tasks.Targets" /> <PropertyGroup> <PackageExtension>zip</PackageExtension> <PackageName>${SolutionName}</PackageName> <PackageOutputPath>output</PackageOutputPath> <DnnLocalDeployPath Condition="'$(OS)' == 'Unix'">/home/user/mnt/dnn</DnnLocalDeployPath> <DnnLocalDeployPath Condition="'$(OS)' != 'Unix'">C:\Dotnetnuke</DnnLocalDeployPath> <MainProjectOutputPath>..\R7.University\bin\$(Configuration)</MainProjectOutputPath> </PropertyGroup> <Import Project="Install.targets" /> <Target Name="AfterBuild" DependsOnTargets="MakeInstallPackage" /> <!-- End snippet --> ```
3. Now switch to "Release" configuration and execute "Build All" command.
4. After this in a `${ProjectName}\output` folder you should find a `.zip` archive for install package.
5. Install required *DotNetNuke.R7* library package.
6. Install your extension from `${SolutionName}-00.01.00-Install.zip` package through *DNN > Host > Extensions*, as usual.
# Developing
1. Switch to "Debug" configuration and execute "Build All" command. This will invoke local deploy script, which will copy new binaries and required source files (such as `.ascx`, '.js', etc.) to DNN install location.
2. Update your site in a browser to trigger recompilation.
# Extending solution
Current scripts automatically able to add all DNN projects inside solution into a single source or install package. The general idea behind that is that all projects in the solution is very dependant.
If you add new DNN extension to your solution using *R7.DnnTemplates*, you probably only need to:
1. Name your project like *${SolutionName}_MyNewExtension*. If not, just add another `<InstallBinaryFiles>` entry to the `Install.targets` for new extension binary file (.dll) too.
2. Move ${ProjectName} Project/EndProject entry in the `${SolutionName}.sln` file to the bottom, to ensure that ${ProjectName} project will build last.
3. Merge new project's `.SqlDataProvider` files, `.dnn` manifest file (and all files, referenced by manifest - generally, it's `license.htm` and `releaseNotes.htm`) into the similar files from first extension.
# General tips
* After external `.sln`, `.csproj` and `.targets` file changes you probably need to reload solution.
